title: [K-12] Web-Based Computer-Assisted Learning Design for Middle School English Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English vocabulary and grammar comprehension
context.additional_context: Web-based learning system operating in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Students can acquire and utilize 500 intermediate-level English vocabulary items within six months through a web-based system
Learners can self-correct over 80% of grammatical errors using real-time feedback functionality

Students submit deliverables applying ≥3 English reading/writing skills (requirements analysis, user story writing, bug report writing) to real-world software development projects (e.g., app proposal drafting, technical document translation) and achieve ≥4 points (out of 5) on the teacher’s evaluation rubric.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
